attributes.action: Birmingham City to respect the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Somalia.
attributes.additional_details:
Reference - https://www.britishempire.co.uk/maproom/britishsomaliland.htm

"Passed a resolution in April 1960 requesting independence of Somalia"
attributes.background: Birmingham should not interfere in the foreign affairs of Somalia. UK recognises Somalia as a sovereign nation and passed a resolution in April 1960 requesting independence of Somalia as a whole. Local political issues of Somalia should not be brought into the council's chamber. Somalia for Somalis.

rejection.details:
This would be a decision for Birmingham Council and not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. 

You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: 

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
